intro: Crotalaria antunesii, commonly known as the Antunes' cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes characterized by their nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers. Its seed pods are typically cylindrical and contain several elliptical seeds. Crotalaria antunesii is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields due to its adaptability to various soil conditions.
